result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:13 PM Defendant EVAN J. FOX appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for EVAN J. FOX. 
motion for bond reduction. Atty Laura Nelson for the State.  
State opposes any modification.  Will be amending the charges based on the victim's injuries and ongoing medical problems and issues.  
Judge rules:  motion is denied at this time.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:41 PM Defendant EVAN J. FOX in court, in custody.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for EVAN J. FOX.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with.  PQW previously efiled.  Court reviews prelim rights w/DE.  DE waives right to prelim.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial.  

ARRAIGNMENT:  
Atty Jaconi - Information has been received and DE enters NG pleas.   Court reviews file, questions  bond modification.  ADA Nelson - bond cannot be heard today, motion was filed this morning and victims were not notified.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Motion hearing on October 18, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
